Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2011 03:02AM calliemom wrote: Has your Breast Surgeon talked about doing an Breast MRI to get a better idea of exactly what is going on?  Doing the MRI they can get a better feel for the size of the tumor plus if there are any other areas.  I had to wait 6 weeks for my surgery because we were moving from Pittsburgh to Tampa.  By the time, I did have my surgery, it had gone to my lymph nodes and I needed chemo.  Now it could have already gone to the lymph nodes anyway.  Just a thought to consider.  No matter what, make sure you are comfortable with your decision and do it as soon as possible after you get back from vacation.  One thing is if you go on your vacation you may be in a better place mentally to deal with the surgery and diagnosis.  As a nurse, you know that attitude makes a huge difference.  Also, I did not see that this was an aggressive tumor, which is  a good thing.  Remember , most of these tumors are there for years before they show up.  You might want to get another opinion just so everyone is more comfortable with your decision. Let me know if you need an awesome breast surgical oncologist.  Monica Dx 7/7/08 Stage 2B ductal and lobular feature, lymph node involvement, ER postive
